page.title: 15Salmon Fishing on the Tweed
page.content: The early records of salmon fishing go back 200 years the main operating company being the Berwick Salmon Company.This company was originally incorporated as The Berwick Shipping Company Ltd. on Nov 1st 1856. at that date its forerunner,The Old Shipping Co.,had already existed for 100 years. During some 200 years m any changes have taken place and great events have altered the course of its history,but the age old method of fishing by net for salmon has not changed a great deal.The net is placed on the stern of the coble so that it pulls off at the correct time and place.A rope,known as the "tow" is attached to one end of the net and is in the control of one of the crew, he ensures that the end of the net stays near to the bank while the coble rows across the river paying out the rest of the net.Cont.
